column1: London Bridge victim's father condemns 'beyond disgusting' Boris Johnson for using son's death for political gain - 'Don’t use my son’s death to promote your vile propaganda. Jack stood against everything you stand for'
column2: Grandmother dumps burnt remains of home at Australian Parliament House in climate change protest

Hong Kong
China accused UN human rights chief of “inappropriate” interference in the country’s affairs after she called for investigations into alleged police brutality in Hong Kong.
column5: Hong Kong protests: over 380K people rally in Hong Kong
column6: You Raped Me When I Was 14!' Yazidi Survivor Confronts ISIS Prisoner Who Assaulted Her
column7: UK police won't pursue case against Prince Andrew or Ghislaine Maxwell
column8: Scientist who helped develop new drug for ovarian cancer donates all profits to charity
column9: China bans US military visits to Hong Kong in response to the HK Human Rights Act
column10: Neo-Nazi scandal hits German elite military unit. The Bundeswehr is set to suspend an officer in an elite military unit over suspected ties to right-wing extremism. Two other fellow soldiers have also been accused of flashing the Hitler salute.
column11: A 15-year-old boy was told to “hold your dick and lift your balls up and show me your gooch” and a police officer “ran his hands around” the buttocks of a 17-year-old during two of 25 potentially illegal strip-searches conducted at an underage music festival in Sydney, an inquiry has heard.
column12: Cuba found to be the most sustainably developed country in the world, new research finds
column13: People in China are now required to have their faces scanned when registering new mobile phone services, as the authorities seek to verify the identities of China's hundreds of millions of internet users. "People are being more and more strictly monitored. What are they [the government] afraid of?"
column14: War against nature must stop,' U.N. chief says before climate talks
column15: Zelensky Tells Trump: Please Stop Saying Ukraine Is Corrupt
column16: Hong Kong Democracy Slogans Heard at Mainland Chinese Protest
column17: Thousands took to the streets across Poland on Sunday to show solidarity with judges after one was suspended for questioning the ruling party’s judicial reforms, in a sign that concerns over the rule of law will mark its second term in power
column18: Hong Kong cop who drove motorbike into protesters back on active duty as police chief rejects inquiry calls
column19: China Targets Uighur Mosques to Eradicate Minority's Faith
column20: World approaching ‘point of no return’ on climate change, UN chief Antonio Guterres warns | U.N. chief said the impact of rising temperatures – including more extreme weather – is already being felt around the world. “It is in sight and hurtling toward us.”
column21: Calls grow to fire University of Alberta lecturer who deemed Ukrainian genocide a 'myth'
column22: Iranian officials 'stealing bodies' from morgues to hide true scale of government crackdown
column23: Samoa measles outbreak: Death toll rises to 53, mostly children. Government declared emergency on November 20 and is stepping up efforts to ensure people are vaccinated against disease.
column24: Six Muslim men sentenced to jail, fine for going to waterfall instead of Friday prayers | Malaysia
column25: Labour leader Corbyn would stop arms sales to Saudi Arabia for use in Yemen
